title: Wigan 1-0 Nottingham Forest: Jamal Lowe scores first Latics goal
text:
Jamal Lowe scored his first Wigan goal to put Nottingham Forest to the sword on Sunday at the DW Stadium.

The visitors - who had the chance to leapfrog West Brom at the top of the table with a comprehensive victory - were denied a penalty when Sammy Ameobi appeared to be dragged down by Antonee Robinson.

Lowe scored the only goal on 35 minutes, combining cleverly with Gaven Massey to poke beyond Brice Samba. Rafa Mir and Lewis Grabban missed inviting opportunities to equalise after half-time as Forest lacked a clinical edge in Lancashire.

More to follow...

Jamal Lowe celebrates after scoring his first goal for Wigan against Nottingham Forest

Lowe latches onto Gavin Massey's cross, poking beyond Forest 'keeper Brice Samba

MATCH FACTS Wigan: Marshall, Byre, Robinson, Macleod, Lowe (Windass 65), Massey (Naismith 65), Mulgrew, Jacobs, Moore (Pilkington (90+5), Williams, Dunkley Subs not used: Jones, Garner, Kipre, Gelhardt Booked: Macleod, Byrne Goals: Lowe (35) Nottingham Forest: Samba, Cash, Figuiredo, Worrall, Robinson (Carvalho 72), Watson, Bostock (Silva 56), Ameobi, Lolley, Ribeiro, Mir (Grabban 55) Subs not used: Muric, Yates, Chema, Adomah Booked: Robeiro Goals: None Referee: Matthew Donohue

Nottingham Forest midfielder Joe Lolley dribbles towards Wigan counterpart Joe Williams

Nottingham Forest manager Sabri Lamouchi was booked in the first half at the DW Stadium
description: RICHARD TANNER AT THE DW STADIUM: Jamal Lowe scored his first Wigan goal to put Nottingham Forest to the sword on Sunday at the DW Stadium.
